info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 17 at 9:17PM CDT until June 17 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR JEFFERSON...SOUTHERN STEPHENS...EAST CENTRAL COTTON AND NORTHEASTERN CLAY COUNTIES... At 917 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Addington to 3 miles west of Sugden, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Waurika, Comanche, Ringling, Ryan, Byers, Hastings, Loco, Addington, Sugden, Waurika Lake, Grady, Oscar, Cornish, and Petersburg. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
